django.core.files.base

Classes

File

A mixin class used to forward file methods to an underlaying file

ContentFile

A File-like object that takes just raw content, rather than an actual file.

Functions

endswith_cr(line)

Return True if line (a text or bytestring) ends with '

endswith_lf(line)

Return True if line (a text or bytestring) ends with '

equals_lf(line)

Return True if line (a text or bytestring) equals '

Module Contents

class django.core.files.base.File(file, name=None)[source]

Bases: django.core.files.utils.FileProxyMixin

A mixin class used to forward file methods to an underlaying file object. The internal file object has to be called “file”:

class FileProxy(FileProxyMixin):
    def __init__(self, file):
        self.file = file
DEFAULT_CHUNK_SIZE = 65536[source]
file[source]
name = None[source]
size()[source]
chunks(chunk_size=None)[source]

Read the file and yield chunks of chunk_size bytes (defaults to File.DEFAULT_CHUNK_SIZE).

multiple_chunks(chunk_size=None)[source]

Return True if you can expect multiple chunks.

NB: If a particular file representation is in memory, subclasses should always return False – there’s no good reason to read from memory in chunks.
